job_tasks.phrase: This assignment is about building a user-friendly and attractive user interface for the existing simulator.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core task of developing a user interface, which is a fundamental software development activity.

job_tasks.phrase: Design and implement extensions for the backend, e.g. REST and websocket interfaces
job_tasks.justification: This refers to building backend services and APIs, which falls under traditional software development and integration.
Writing tests is a standard part of the software development lifecycle, ensuring code quality and functionality.

job_tasks.phrase: To elicit the right design requirements and validate your work, you will work with data scientists and a production engineer from one of our clients on building a simulation of a real production line.
job_tasks.justification: This involves requirement gathering and validation, which are integral parts of the software development process, especially when integrating with other domains.

job_tasks.phrase: This simulator generates realistic data for experimentation with international standards and new technology (e.g. generative AI).
job_tasks.justification: The mention of generating realistic data for experimentation, even if the primary role is frontend, touches upon data generation aspects relevant to data engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: If any simulation capabilities are missing, either you or another team member will implement those.
job_tasks.justification: This implies potential involvement in implementing simulation capabilities, which can involve data handling and processing logic.

job_tasks.phrase: Learn about Industry 4.0 and the manufacturing domain
job_tasks.justification: This task requires understanding the business context and domain, aligning with business understanding.

job_tasks.phrase: Investigate & evaluate concepts and solutions for defining experiments and low-code integration of 3rd party software
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding business needs and evaluating solutions, which falls under business understanding and strategy.
Evaluating user experience is directly related to understanding user needs and business context for product development.

job_tasks.justification: Working with clients and other domain experts is a key aspect of understanding business needs and aligning technical solutions.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses heavily on traditional software development tasks (frontend UI, backend extensions, REST/websocket interfaces, unit/integration tests) which fall under Macro-Category A. While it mentions 'generative AI' as a technology being experimented with in the simulator, the core responsibilities of the intern are to build and integrate the user interface and backend for this simulator. There are no explicit tasks related to developing, fine-tuning, or prompt engineering of AI models themselves. The role is about building software that *uses* or *supports* AI experimentation, rather than being an AI specialist. Therefore, 'AI-Adjacent Software Engineer' is the most fitting profile.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear about the tasks involved, which are predominantly software development. The mention of 'generative AI' is in the context of the simulator's purpose, not the intern's direct responsibilities. The technologies and expected skills align well with a frontend/full-stack developer role, making the classification straightforward.
